intro: Sida cordifolia var. serrata, commonly known as the serrated sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its lanceolate, serrated leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fibrous roots and hairy stems are typical of the genus Sida. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks.
